ai.summary: An easy, coastal 4.7 km loop at Ness of Burravoe on Yell, Shetland. The route features flat to gently undulating paths with sea views, grassy sections and occasional rocky or muddy patches; suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a relaxed coastal stroll.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal grassy and gravel paths with occasional rocky shoreline sections. Watch for occasional mud in wetter conditions and exposed wind along the coast; footing can be uneven in places.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather forecast before starting, as parts of the route are coastal. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers; bring a rain jacket. Carry a map or offline navigation on your phone, plus water and a small first aid kit. Stay on marked paths, avoid cliff edges, and inform someone of your plan and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Map, compass, or offline navigation on a phone
Fully charged phone and emergency contact info
Small first aid kit and whistle
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offers the most comfortable conditions; the walk is doable year-round with appropriate gear.

seo.title: Ness of Burravoe Coastal Walk – Easy 4.7 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Ness of Burravoe, a gentle 4.7 km coastal hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for this easy walk.
